Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic cecal adenocarcinoma with signet ring features
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	Commenced FOLFOX + Bevacizumab 12 Feb 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging

	Current issues
	Mild peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	I was very pleased to review [redacted name] today who attended with his wife for assessment prior to cycle 4 FOLFOX with Bevacizumab. He has been managing the treatment remarkably well and maintaining an excellent quality of life. His appetite remains good and he has maintained his weight at 78kg. He continues his regular swimming three times per week which is wonderful to see.

He has developed mild tingling in his fingertips which is an expected side effect of the oxaliplatin component. This is currently grade 1 and not interfering with daily activities. No other significant toxicities noted.

CT scan performed last week shows stable disease compared to baseline, with the primary cecal mass unchanged in size at 6.8cm and stable peritoneal deposits. His CEA has decreased from 245 to 180.

	Further investigations
	Routine bloods including CEA prior to next cycle

	Medication prescribed
	Continue current supportive medications

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks prior to cycle 5

	Required GP actions
	None required at present
